name: @local/root
description: Root - running 'firebase-jest-testing' against a sample project.

scripts.test: concurrently --kill-others --success=first --prefix none "npm run start" "wait-for 6767 && wait-for 5002 && npm run -s _test1"
scripts._test1: npm run -s test:fns:all && npm run -s test:rules:all
scripts.start: firebase emulators:start --project=demo-1 | grep -v -E "Detected demo project|You are not currently authenticated|You are not signed in to the Firebase CLI"
scripts.ci:test: wait-for emul:6767 && wait-for emul:5002 && npm run -s _ci_warm-up && npm run -s _test1
scripts.//timings:2: NODE_OPTIONS=--experimental-vm-modules jest --config sample/test-rules/jest.config.js -f projectsC.test.js -t 'unauthenticated access should fail' --verbose --detectOpenHandles --all

--experimental-vm-modules: Needed for now (May 2021, ~Aug 2020~), to use native ES6 modules with Jest
If httpsCallables are among the emulated features, Cloud Functions needs a project id. The value is used in
construction of the URL for the callable.
engines.npm: >= 7.7.0 because of this (only matters for 'npm publish') -> https://github.com/npm/cli/issues/2834

@local/self: Allows us to use the 'bin' section to alias commands.

NODE_OPTIONS=--experimental-vm-modules: Still needed on both Node.js 14 and 16. (not knowing where to track it's removal)
_ci_warm-up: Warm-up is used to guarantee normal tests run within the 2000 ms timeout.
no [[: Don't use '[[' (bash syntax). 'npm-alpine' used in CI only provides sh. '[' works.
